member.name: T:GameSparks.RT.IRTCommand
member.summary: IRTCommand. THe interface that objects returned from OnCustom need to implement. Code within OnCustom runs in a background Thread, so for Engines like unity UI updates cannot be performed in this method. These returned objects are executed on calls to IRTSession.Update(), and are executed on the thread that calls this method. This pattern allows you to run code in both the background, and foreground threads when a custom message is received

member.name: M:GameSparks.RT.IRTCommand.Execute
member.summary: Execute this instance. Executed on calls to IRTSession.Update()

member.name: T:GameSparks.RT.GameSparksRT.ConnectState
member.summary: The state of the current SDK

member.name: F:GameSparks.RT.GameSparksRT.ConnectState.Disconnected
member.summary: Disconnected.

member.name: F:GameSparks.RT.GameSparksRT.ConnectState.Connecting
member.summary: Connecting.

member.name: F:GameSparks.RT.GameSparksRT.ConnectState.ReliableOnly
member.summary: Only a TCP connection is established.

member.name: F:GameSparks.RT.GameSparksRT.ConnectState.ReliableAndFastSend
member.summary: We've successfully send some UDP and the server has recieved it, but have not recieved any

member.name: F:GameSparks.RT.GameSparksRT.ConnectState.ReliableAndFast
member.summary: All systems go. We can send and recieve UCP.

member.name: T:GameSparks.RT.GameSparksRT.DeliveryIntent
member.summary: How the message should be attempted to be sent. If ConnectState==ReliableOnly the message will be sent as RELIABLE

member.name: F:GameSparks.RT.GameSparksRT.DeliveryIntent.RELIABLE
member.summary: Send over TCP

member.name: F:GameSparks.RT.GameSparksRT.DeliveryIntent.UNRELIABLE
member.summary: Send over UDP, don't discard out of sequence packets

member.name: F:GameSparks.RT.GameSparksRT.DeliveryIntent.UNRELIABLE_SEQUENCED
member.summary: Send over UDP, discard out of sequence packets

member.name: T:GameSparks.RT.IRTSession
member.summary: The realtime session interface. An instance if this interface can be obtainedfrom RTSessionFactory Each realtime session will have a single instance of this interface.

member.summary: Starts the session and connects to the real time services.

member.name: M:GameSparks.RT.IRTSession.Stop
member.summary: Starts the session and disconnects from the real time services.

member.name: M:GameSparks.RT.IRTSession.Update
member.summary: This method should be called as frequently as possible by the thread you want Your callbacks to execute on. In unity, you should call this from an Update method in a MonoBehaviour
